page.title: 03Aldersey Village
page.content: Aldersey contains 784 acres of land with a strong clay soil.It had a population of 154 in 1800 with a rateable value of Â£900. The population in 1985 is 58 adults and 11 children. The Aldersey family were the principal landowners from the time of Edward III but the farms on the estate were sold to tenants in 1980. Leyland,in his itinerary,noticed the existence of saltworks. More recently Aldersey kiln was used to make bricks for Coddington mill in 1774 but nowadays Aldersey is known for dairy farming and farmhouse Cheshire cheese. Aldersey Hall was a handsome stuccoed mansion re-erected in 1811 but it became derelict and the site was recently used for 9 expensive private houses.The last member of the Aldersey family left Aldersey in 1985.
